</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revolving Credit Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The revolving credit facility provides for a maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$150,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of revolving credit, subject to borrowing base availability. The borrowing base is currently equal to specified percentages of the Company's eligible accounts receivable, inventories, fixed assets and real property less reserves established, from time to time, by the administrative agent under the facility. The revolving credit facility matures on March 14, 2019. The revolving credit facility is secured by a first priority lien on substantially all of the Company's assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	At the Company's election, advances of the revolving credit facility bear interest at annual rates equal to either (a) LIBOR for 1, 2 or 3 month periods, as selected by the Company, plus an applicable margin of either
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, or (b) the higher of the prime rate, the Federal Funds rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, or a daily LIBOR rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, plus an applicable margin of either
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The applicable margin is determined based on availability under the revolving credit facility with margins increasing as availability decreases. The Company pays an unused line fee on the average amount by which the aggregate commitments exceed utilization of the revolving credit facility equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.375%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per annum. The weighted-average interest rate on borrowings outstanding under the revolving credit facility was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.23%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;at December 26, 2015 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.29%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;at December 27, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The revolving credit facility includes certain affirmative and negative covenants that impose restrictions on the Company's financial and business operations. The revolving credit facility requires the Company to maintain a fixed charge coverage ratio of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to 1.0 during any period that borrowing availability was less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$16,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. As of December 26, 2015, the unused borrowing availability under the revolving credit facility was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$39,821
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. As of December 26, 2015, the Company's fixed charge coverage ratio was less than 1.1 to 1.0, accordingly, the unused availability accessible by the Company is the amount above
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$16,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes Payable - Buildings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On November 7, 2014, the Company entered into a ten-year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$8,330
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;note payable to purchase a previously leased distribution center in Adairsville, Georgia. The note payable is scheduled to mature on November 7, 2024 and is secured by the distribution center. The note payable bears interest at a variable rate equal to one-month LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and is payable in equal monthly installments of principal of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$35
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, plus interest calculated on the declining balance of the note, with a final payment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4,165
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;due on maturity. In addition, the Company entered into an interest rate swap with an amortizing notional amount effective November 7, 2014 which effectively fixes the interest rate at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On January 23, 2015, the Company entered into a ten-year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$6,290
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;note payable to finance an owned facility in Saraland, Alabama. The note payable is scheduled to mature on January 7, 2025 and is secured by the facility. The note payable bears interest at a variable rate equal to one-month LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and is payable in equal monthly installments of principal of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$26
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, plus interest calculated on the declining balance of the note, with a final payment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3,145
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;due on maturity. In addition, the Company entered into a forward interest rate swap with an amortizing notional amount effective January 7, 2017 which effectively fixes the interest rate at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4.30%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_SE38061C5977658E1A0FADAFB2184BAB7">

<A NAME="A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_S7BB22F03330A5526829302F1A8F54018">
</A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	THE DIXIE GROUP, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;(amounts in thousands, except per share data)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Acquisition Note Payable - Development Authority of Gordon County
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On November 2, 2012, the Company signed a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;seller-financed note of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$5,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;with Lineage PCR, Inc. (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Lineage
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	) related to the acquisition of a continuous carpet dyeing facility in Calhoun, Georgia. Effective December 28, 2012, through a series of agreements between the Company, the Development Authority of Gordon County, Georgia (the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Authority
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	) and Lineage, obligations with identical payment terms as the original note to Lineage became payment obligations to the Authority. These transactions were consummated in order to provide a tax abatement to the Company related to the real estate and equipment at this facility. The tax abatement plan provides for abatement for certain components of the real and personal property taxes for up to ten years. At any time, the Company has the option to pay off the obligation, plus a nominal amount. The debt to the Authority bears interest at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and is payable in equal monthly installments of principal and interest of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$106
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	57
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;months.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Acquisition Note Payable - Robertex
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On July 1, 2013, the Company signed a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;seller-financed note of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, which was recorded at a fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3,749
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, with Robert P. Rothman related to the acquisition of Robertex Associates, LLC ("Robertex") in Calhoun, Georgia. The note is payable in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;annual installments of principal of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$800
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;plus interest. The note matures June 30, 2018.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes Payable - Equipment and Other
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company's equipment financing notes have terms ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;years, bear interest ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.86%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and are due in monthly or quarterly installments through their maturity dates. In connection with certain of the notes, the Company is required to maintain funds in a separate escrow account. At December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, the balances held were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$574
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, respectively, and are included in other current assets on the Company&#8217;s Consolidated Balance Sheets. The Company's equipment financing notes are secured by the specific equipment financed and do not contain any financial covenants.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Capital Lease Obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	7
</FONT>

	&#32;years, bear interest ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	7.37%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and are due in monthly or quarterly installments through their maturity dates. The Company's capital lease obligations are secured by the specific equipment leased.

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

	Total long-term debt
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_S0B9BCA3B6C1A57898697DD82A1592BF8">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE 11 - FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Fair value is defined as the exchange value of an asset or a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants.&#160;The fair value guidance outlines a valuation framework and establishes a fair value hierarchy in order to increase the consistency and comparability of fair value measurements and disclosures. The hierarchy consists of three levels as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Level 1 - Quoted market prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities as of the reported date;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Level 2 - Other than quoted market prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities, quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active, and other than
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_SE38061C5977658E1A0FADAFB2184BAB7">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	THE DIXIE GROUP, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;(amounts in thousands, except per share data)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	quoted prices for assets or liabilities and prices that are derived principally from or corroborated by market data by correlation or other means; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Level 3 - Measurements using management's best estimate of fair value, where the determination of fair value requires significant management judgment or estimation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following table reflects the fair values of assets and liabilities measured and recognized at fair value on a recurring basis on the Company's Consolidated Balance Sheets as of December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

</EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The Company uses certain external sources in deriving the fair value of the interest rate swaps. The interest rate swaps were valued using observable inputs (e.g., LIBOR yield curves, credit spreads). Valuations of interest rate swaps may fluctuate considerably from period-to-period due to volatility in underlying interest rates, which are driven by market conditions and the duration of the instrument. Credit adjustments could have a significant impact on the valuations due to changes in credit ratings of the Company or its counterparties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	As a result of the Colormaster and Crown Rug acquisitions in 2012 and the Robertex acquisition in 2013, the Company recorded contingent consideration liabilities at fair value. These fair value measurements were based on calculations that utilize significant inputs not observable in the market including forecasted revenues, gross margins and discount rates and thus represent Level 3 measurements. These fair value measurements are directly impacted by the Company's estimates. Accordingly, if the estimates are higher or lower than the estimates within the fair value measurement, the Company would record additional charges or benefits, respectively, as appropriate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Changes in the fair value measurements using significant unobservable inputs (Level 3) during the years ending
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;27, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;were as follows:
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	There were no transfers of assets or liabilities between Level 1, Level 2 and Level 3 during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. If any, the Company recognizes the transfers in or transfers out at the end of the reporting period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	The carrying amounts and estimated fair values of the Company's financial instruments are summarized as follows:

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The fair values of the Company's long-term debt and capital leases were estimated using market rates the Company believes would be available for similar types of financial instruments and represent level 2 measurements.&#160;The fair values of cash and cash equivalents and notes receivable approximate their carrying amounts due to the short-term nature of the financial instruments.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	THE DIXIE GROUP, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;(amounts in thousands, except per share data)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	(Continued)
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_S36ED8C9CF8A65282B292BBF75CA75A0D">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE 12 - DERIVATIVES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company's earnings, cash flows and financial position are exposed to market risks relating to interest rates.&#160;It is the Company's policy to minimize its exposure to adverse changes in interest rates and manage interest rate risks inherent in funding the Company with debt.&#160;The Company addresses this risk by maintaining a mix of fixed and floating rate debt and entering into interest rate swaps for a portion of its variable rate debt to minimize interest rate volatility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following is a summary of the Company's interest rate swaps as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	(442
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The amount of gain (loss) reclassified from AOCIL is included in interest expense on the Company's Consolidated Statements of Operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	The amount of loss expected to be reclassified from AOCIL into earnings during the next 12 months subsequent to fiscal 2015 is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$1,159
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	.

<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_SE38061C5977658E1A0FADAFB2184BAB7">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage53"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	THE DIXIE GROUP, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;(amounts in thousands, except per share data)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The amount of gain (loss) recognized in income on the ineffective portion of interest rate swaps, if any, is included in other (income) expense, net on the Company's Consolidated Statements of Operations. There was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;ineffective portion for the periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_SD307B12BDB76520182E128C06C7F56A5">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE 13 - EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Defined Contribution Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company sponsors a 401(k) defined contribution plan that covers a significant portion, or approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	86%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the Company's associates. This plan includes a mandatory Company match on the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of participants' contributions. The Company matches the next
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of participants' contributions if the Company meets prescribed earnings levels. The plan also provides for additional Company contributions above the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;level if the Company attains certain additional performance targets. Matching contribution expense for this 401(k) plan was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$454
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$382
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$610
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Additionally, the Company sponsors a 401(k) defined contribution plan that covers those associates at one facility who are under a collective-bargaining agreement, or approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	14%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the Company's associates. Under this plan, the Company generally matches participants' contributions, on a sliding scale, up to a maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the participant's earnings. Matching contribution expense for the collective-bargaining 401(k) plan was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$82
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$87
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$86
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Non-Qualified Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company sponsors a non-qualified retirement savings plan that allows eligible associates to defer a specified percentage of their compensation. The obligations owed to participants under this plan were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$14,155
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$14,331
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;27, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and are included in other long-term liabilities in the Company's Consolidated Balance Sheets. The obligations are unsecured general obligations of the Company and the participants have no right, interest or claim in the assets of the Company, except as unsecured general creditors. The Company utilizes a Rabbi Trust to hold, invest and reinvest deferrals and contributions under the plan. Amounts are invested in Company-owned life insurance in the Rabbi Trust and the cash surrender value of the policies was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$14,981
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$15,316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;27, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and is included in other assets in the Company's Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Multi-Employer Pension Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company contributes to a multi-employer pension plan under the terms of a collective-bargaining agreement that covers its union-represented employees.These union-represented employees represented approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	14%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the Company's total employees. The risks of participating in multi-employer plans are different from single-employer plans. If a participating employer stops contributing to the plan, the unfunded obligations of the plan may be borne by the remaining participating employers. If the Company chooses to stop participating in the multi-employer plan, the Company may be required to pay the plan an amount based on the underfunded status of the plan, referred to as a withdrawal liability.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company's participation in the multi-employer pension plan for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;is provided in the table below. The "EIN/Pension Plan Number" column provides the Employee Identification Number (EIN) and the three digit plan number. The most recent Pension Protection Act (PPA) zone status available in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;is for the plan's year-end at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, respectively. The zone status is based on information that the Company received from the plan and is certified by the plan's actuary. Among other factors, plans in the red zone are generally less than 65% funded, plans in the yellow zone are less than 80% funded and plans in the green zone are at least 80% funded. The "FIP/RP Status Pending/Implemented" column indicates a plan for which a financial improvement plan (FIP) or a rehabilitation plan (RP) is either pending or has been implemented. The last column lists the expiration date of the collective-bargaining agreement to which the plan is subject.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD ROWSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<TD ROWSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

	Expiration Date of Collective-Bargaining Agreement
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;TEXT-INDENT:-18PX;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1) The collective-bargaining agreement requires the Company to contribute to the plan at the rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$0.47
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;per compensated hour for each covered employee. The Company will make additional contributions, as mandated by law, in accordance with the fund's 2010 Rehabilitation Plan which required a surcharge equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$0.03
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;per hour (from $0.47 to $0.50) effective June 1, 2014 to May 31, 2015 and a surcharge equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$0.03
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;per hour (from $0.50 to $0.53) effective June 1, 2015 to May 31, 2016, respectively. Based upon current employment and benefit levels, the Company's contributions to the multi-employer pension plan are expected to be approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$281
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;for 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;TEXT-INDENT:-18PX;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(2) The Company's contributions to the plan do not represent more than 5% of the total contributions to the plan for the most recent plan year available.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Postretirement Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company inherited a legacy postretirement benefit plan that provides life insurance to a limited number of associates as a result of a prior acquisition. The Company also sponsors a postretirement benefit plan that provides medical insurance for a limited number of associates who retired prior to January 1, 2003 and life insurance to a limited number of associates upon retirement as part of a collective bargaining agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Differences between the provision (benefit) for income taxes and the amount computed by applying the statutory federal income tax rate to income (loss) from continuing operations before taxes are summarized as follows:

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	(577
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2015, the Company increased valuation allowances by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$977
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;related to state income tax loss carryforwards and state income tax credit carryforwards to reflect the estimated amount of deferred tax assets that may not be realized during the carryforward periods.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2014, the Company increased valuation allowances by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$569
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;related to state income tax loss carryforwards and credit carryforwards. This was primarily the result of actual 2014 pretax earnings being significantly less that the 2014 forecasted earnings used in the 2013 analysis, a change in California apportionment rules that limit the utilization of net operating loss and credit carryforwards in future years and a projected tax loss in 2014 that resulted in the need to record a valuation allowance against that loss in separate company reporting states.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	During 2013, the Company reversed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1,190
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of previously established reserves related to state income tax loss carryforwards and state income tax credit carryforwards. The reversal of the reserves was based on a number of factors including current and future earnings assumptions by taxing jurisdiction. Additionally, 2013 included certain tax credits of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$520
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;related to 2009 - 2011 determined to be available for utilization and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$304
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of 2012 research and development tax credits that could not be recognized until the extension of the credit was approved by Congress in 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Income tax payments, net of income tax refunds received for continuing and discontinued operations were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$48
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$345
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in 2014 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$58
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;" HREF="#A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_SE38061C5977658E1A0FADAFB2184BAB7">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3,346
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	At December 26, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4,345
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of deferred tax assets related to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$12,415
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of federal net operating loss carryforwards and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3,563
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of deferred tax assets related to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$80,881
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of state net operating loss carryforwards. In addition,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2,943
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of federal tax credit carryforwards and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1,731
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of state tax credit carryforwards were available to the Company. The federal net operating loss carryforwards and the federal tax credit carryforwards will expire between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2030
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2036
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The state net operating loss carryforwards and the state tax credit carryforwards will expire between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2036
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. A valuation allowance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$5,294
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;is recorded to reflect the estimated amount of deferred tax assets that may not be realized during the carryforward periods. At December 26, 2015, the Company is in a net deferred tax asset position of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4,726
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;which is included in other assets in the Company's Consolidated Balance Sheets. The Company performed an analysis related to the net deferred tax asset and believes that the net tax asset is recoverable in future periods.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Tax Uncertainties
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company accounts for uncertainty in income tax positions according to FASB guidance relating to uncertain tax positions. Unrecognized tax benefits were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$375
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$400
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;at December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, respectively.&#160;Such benefits, if recognized, would affect the Company's effective tax rate. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;significant interest or penalties accrued as of December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</DIV>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company and its subsidiaries are subject to United States federal income taxes, as well as income taxes in a number of state jurisdictions. The tax years subsequent to 2011 remain open to examination for U.S. federal income taxes.&#160;The majority of state jurisdictions remain open for tax years subsequent to 2011. A few state jurisdictions remain open to examination for tax years subsequent to 2010.
</FONT>

<A NAME="A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_SEB00CCB507785EDDA42181CDB656459F">
</A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	THE DIXIE GROUP, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;(amounts in thousands, except per share data)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:6PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="A2015DXYN10-K_HTM_S6A6B8D7B5EC958519C3DB4DFE553445A">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE 15 - COMMON STOCK AND EARNINGS (LOSS) PER SHARE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Common &amp; Preferred Stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company's charter authorizes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	80,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of Common Stock with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;par value per share and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	16,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of Class B Common Stock with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;par value per share. Holders of Class B Common Stock have the right to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	twenty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;votes per share on matters that are submitted to Shareholders for approval and to dividends in an amount not greater than dividends declared and paid on Common Stock. &#160;Class B Common Stock is restricted as to transferability and may be converted into Common Stock on a one share for one share basis.&#160;The Company's charter also authorizes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	200,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of Class C Common Stock,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;par value per share, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	16,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of Preferred Stock. &#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of Class C Common Stock or Preferred Stock have been issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On May 20, 2014, the Company completed an equity offering of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2,500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of Common Stock at a price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$10.65
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share, raising approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$24,559
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;after deducting underwriter fees and costs directly related to the offering. The Company used the net proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes and to reduce the balance under the Company's revolving credit facility, including borrowings associated with the acquisition of Atlas Carpet Mills.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Earnings (Loss) Per Share
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The Company's unvested stock awards that contain non-forfeitable rights to dividends or dividend equivalents, whether paid or unpaid, are considered participating securities and are included in the computation of earnings per share. The accounting guidance requires additional disclosure of EPS for common stock and unvested share-based payment awards, separately disclosing distributed and undistributed earnings. Undistributed earnings represent earnings that were available for distribution but were not distributed. Common stock and unvested share-based payment awards earn dividends equally. &#160;All earnings were undistributed in all periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted earnings (loss) per share from continuing operations:
</FONT>
</DIV>
